intro: Citropsis preussii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Citropsis preussii is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
